item.description:
On Saturday, 27 February, Atwoods Tavern in Cambridge is hosting a fundraiser to benefit the 2nd Annual New England Surf Camp for Children, taking place in Narragansett, RI in September 2010. The camp is run by Surfers Healing, a donor-supported foundation for autism based in San Juan Capistrano.

Surfers Healing was started by Israel and Danielle Paskowitz when their son, Isaiah, was diagnosed with autism. Israel, a former competitive surfer, found that surfing simply transformed his son and others with autism, helping them cope with sensory inputs that were usually overwhelming. The Providence Journal, reporting on last year's surfer's camp, noted that parents found the effect to be "remarkable, even magical".

Come on out to have a good time and hear some great music while supporting a great cause. ($10 donation.)

Saturday's event runs from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. and features these great local musicians:


  • Rick Berlin (Berlin Airlift, many other projects)
  • The Dennis Brennan Quatro
  • Jesse Dee (solo artist, Sea Monsters)
  • Andrea Gillis
  • Christian McNeill (solo artist, Sea Monsters)
item.how_to_find_us: On Saturday morning I will email a cell # to everyone who RSVPs Yes or Maybe
item.name: Fundraiser for "Surfers Healing: A Foundation for Autism" @ Atwoods Tavern
